N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7870.9 - Role of social services district offices and emergency agencies

State Regulations
(a) Social services
district offices shall investigate the circumstances of those customers with
respect to which they have received a notice of cutoff of heating fuel
deliveries, as directed by the New York State Department of Social Services. Based on such investigation, social services district offices shall take
whatever actions are appropriate and necessary, as directed by the New York

State Department of Social Services, to provide any financial assistance for
which customers may be eligible, and to provide or arrange for the provision of
such other forms of assistance or social services as may be available from the
district or from other government agencies. (b) Emergency agencies shall: (1)
pursuant to their powers and duties under
law, take any reasonable action as if immediately necessary on a temporary
basis to prevent loss of life or serious danger to public health; and
(2)
notify the appropriate social services
district offices by telephone on the next business day after a notification is
received, and provide the information the emergency agency received and a brief
description of any temporary action taken to prevent loss of life or serious
danger to public health. Notes
